message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to show you this amazing product. I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $110. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

I understand you're interested in the product, Bob! I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm not quite comfortable with $110. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $125. What do you think?
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $115 for the product. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?
I understand your budget constraints, Bob! I'm willing to make another concession. I'll meet you at $122.50. It's the highest I can go without compromising my own profit margin. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $118 for the product. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned about the negotiations, Bob. I've already compromised a lot, and I'm not sure I can go any lower. However, I'm willing to make one more offer. I'll meet you at $125, but that's as low as I can go. What do you think?
I understand you've compromised a lot, Alice, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. I'm willing to pay $117 for the product. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $126, but that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to reconsider the deal. What do you think?
I understand you're getting close to your minimum price, Alice, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. I'm willing to pay $116 for the product. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?
